stimulusHtml: Which of the following describes the impact of an automatic stabilizer during an economic contraction?
choicesHtml: As incomes rise, more individuals move up to higher income tax brackets, causing an automatic tax increase and reducing consumption.
As prices fall, workers accept lower wages, causing short-run aggregate supply to increase.
As unemployment falls, fewer individuals receive unemployment benefits, reducing consumption.
As unemployment rises, the government implements a tax decrease, stimulating consumption.
As unemployment rises, more individuals receive unemployment benefits, stimulating consumption.
